title: Police investigating what led to fatal shooting
content:
A 24-year-old woman is dead after being shot in Battle Creek.
BATTLE CREEK, Mich. (NEWSCHANNEL 3) - A woman is shot and killed in Battle Creek. Investigators questioned the woman's boyfriend Sunday afternoon, trying to figure out how it happened.
Newschannel 3's Logan Crawford is live at the Battle Creek Police Department.
Police say the 24-year-old mother of two died after a single gunshot wound. Officers tell Newschannel 3 that both children were in the home at the time.
Valentine's Day ended tragically at the home on Highway Street. Neighbors say they are saddened by the loss. Edward Quesada says, "I saw her taking her kids to school from time to time just like I do myself."
Battle Creek Police say they got the 911 call Sunday at 1:30 p.m. They say the woman died of a single gunshot wound to her left side. Officers questioned the 25-year-old male who was present at the time of the shooting. Det. Sgt. Troy Gilleylen says the gun was fired in an upstairs bedroom: "It was just a female and an acquaintance -- possibly a boyfriend -- that was upstairs at the time together. And the female was pretty much pronounced deceased at the scene."
Newschannel 3's cameras were rolling as police dropped the man back at home, at 6 p.m. on Sunday. No arrests have been made. Family members of the victim's boyfriend declined to speak with Newschannel 3.
Police say the gunshot could be accidental or self-inflicted. Gilleylen says the man who was in the home at the time "has been very cooperative so we're still working on his side of what took place."
The shooting is still under investigation. Police say the couple does not have a history of violence.
